intro: Mosla chinensis var. kiangsiensis, commonly known as Chinese bugloss, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers in racemes, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
